text: In Greek mythology, Arke is the daughter of Thaumas.Nathan Covington Brooks,Four Books of the Metamorphoses of Publius Ovidius Naso (New York: A. Hinds & Co., 1890), p. 231 Her sister is Iris, the rainbow goddess.Csenge Vir√°g Zalka, Tales of Superhuman Powers: 55 Traditional Stories from Around the World (Jefferson, NC: McFarland & Company, Inc. Publishers, 2013), p. 58 Arke and her sister Iris had wings and were the messengers of the Olympian gods. When the gods were fighting the Titans, Arke betrayed the gods and joined the Titans against them. When the Olympians won, Zeus took Arke's wings and cast her into Tartarus. Arke's wings were later given to Thetis as a gift on her wedding day. Thetis later gave them to her son Achilles. She tied them to his ankles. which is where his surname Podarces (literally "swift-footed") came from.Ptolemy Hephaestion, New History, 6 in Photius, Bibliotheca, 190 == References == Category:Greek gods and goddesses
title: Arke (mythology)
